summary: Build an international contact search module integrated with the existing AntiFraud Heuristics Engine, exposed in a new dedicated frontend page, using a backend/canister intermediary to call external APIs securely and return detailed, source-referenced, legally-compliant risk assessments. Also remove the 'Caffeine' name from the app and ensure footer images include clickable source links.
architectural_notes: Frontend should call a backend/canister intermediary for all external API integrations to keep API keys private; frontend receives processed/aggregated results only.
International contact search must return detailed, structured outputs (not just safe/risky) including risk status, origin country, public confirmation sources, and public report/alert history.
Legal/compliance constraint: only use public information or legally-provided APIs; every data point should be source-referenced with clickable links.
known_issues: Footer images currently lack embedded/clickable source (attribution) links.
Application currently shows the name “Caffeine” but user does not want it displayed.

existing_features.title: Add a new dedicated frontend page for the international contact lookup module (route + UI) and make it accessible from the main navigation menu.
Extend the frontend routing to include the new international lookup page without breaking existing routes, consent-gate behavior, and SPA fallback routing.

Integrate/extend the existing AntiFraud Heuristics Engine logic to compute an international risk score using: automatic phone normalization (+country code), country detection by prefix for phone numbers, and public-source signals (reports/alerts) returned by providers, producing low/medium/high risk status.
Update the frontend canister interface bindings to include the new backend method(s) and wire the new international lookup page UI to call the backend and render the returned structured result.
Remove any visible 'Caffeine' branding from the application UI and metadata wherever it currently appears.
Make footer data-source images/logos clickable with embedded attribution/source links, while preserving correct static asset paths and 16x16 mobile visibility.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create new frontend page “Pesquisa Internacional de Contactos” accessible from the main menu
Implement backend/canister intermediary to call external verification/abuse APIs without exposing API keys to the frontend

Integrate external sources (NumVerify, OpenCnam, Spamhaus, PhishTank, HaveIBeenPwned, Banco de Portugal, CNCS, and other public country registries) and return detailed structured results with clickable source links
Extend existing AntiFraud Heuristics Engine to process international contact signals (normalize +DDI, detect country by prefix, compute risk score low/medium/high, include public reports/alerts)
Remove the name/branding “Caffeine” from the application UI
Add clickable source links to footer images (embed the image source/attribution links)

Implement a secure backend/canister intermediary method to perform an international contact lookup and return a detailed, structured, legally-compliant result that includes per-field source attribution URLs.
Add backend support for provider configuration management so external API integrations can be enabled without exposing keys to the frontend.

projectName: International Contact Lookup module (secure backend intermediary + new page) with legal, source-referenced results
